AHIP Privacy Policy share
  • f
  • l

AMERICA’S HEALTH INSURANCE PLANS

PRIVACY POLICY STATEMENT

Effective Date:  May 2016

The America’s Health Insurance Plans (“AHIP”) is concerned with safeguarding your privacy on-line. . Accordingly, AHIP has developed this policy statement to assist you in understanding why AHIP collects particular personal identifying information and how AHIP will protect your personal privacy within its Web site (the “Privacy Policy”). . By making you aware of AHIP’s data collection and use practices, we can provide you with better service.

The following information summarizes our personal identifying information gathering and dissemination practices for the AHIP’s United States Web site located at the URL, www.ahip.org, (the “Site”). . Personal identifying information includes information that can be linked to a specific individual, such as a name, address, phone number, or e-mail address.

AHIP reserves the right to change this Privacy Policy at any time. . If AHIP makes material changes to this Privacy Policy, AHIP will post those changes at this location so that you are aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances, if any, we disclose it. . Please review this Privacy Policy on a periodic basis.

By using our website, you consent to the collection and use of your information by AHIP, as described below.

What Information Does AHIP Collect?

Users may visit the website without giving AHIP any personal information. However, users will need to register to gain access to the member-only content, receive customized information, or enroll or participate in an AHIP-sponsored education or training program.

AHIP will collect name, title, employer, mailing address, telephone number, fax number and email address contact demographic information voluntarily provided by individuals who register on AHIP’s website. We also collect Internet Protocol (IP) addresses from all users of our Site, the date and time of access, and may catalog the type of computer, browser, or operating system used by the user. . For individuals who register for conferences or webinars, enroll in education and training programs or make publications purchases, additional payment-related information may be collected.

How Does AHIP Use that Information?

Until you register to gain access to the member only section of the AHIP website, or register or enroll in an AHIP-sponsored webinar, education or training program, you are able to browse the Site without providing any personal identifying information, although your browser may tell us what type of computer and operating system you are using as well as other kinds of technical information.

Below, is more detail on how AHIP uses the personal identifying information of those individuals who have registered for the member-only section of the site, or registered or enrolled in an AHIP-sponsored webinar, education or training program.

Contact Information: . AHIP may use your contact information, such as name, email address, and mailing address, to provide its services, to advertise its services and the goods and services of third parties, to provide you with news, updates, products, services, upcoming events and other information, and to get in touch with you when necessary with respect to transactions conducted through the Site, or otherwise. . We do share your contact information with webinar and other program sponsors, and our business partners which assist us in providing our services. . Except for sharing arrangements with AHIP’s business partners or as otherwise described in this policy or at the time of collection, we do not share your contact information with other types of third parties for any other purpose, except to a court or governmental agency if required by law or unless we first obtain consent from you to do so. . Site visitors who do not wish to receive notifications or other information via email can choose to opt out of receiving such information at any time so indicating either at time of registration or upon receipt of any promotional email.

Demographic Information:   AHIP may use or share, lease, rent, license, and/or sell demographic data on an aggregated basis, which will not identify any particular user, with our business partners, suppliers, and for advertising purposes.

Transactional Information:  . AHIP may use or share, lease, rent, license, and/or sell transactional data on an aggregated basis, which will not identify any particular user with advertisers or other third parties, including our business partners, suppliers, sponsors, and vendors, for business purposes.

Technical Information:  . AHIP may use technical information, such as your IP address or browser type, to help diagnose problems with our servers, analyze Site usage trends, track user movements on the Site, and to otherwise manage and monitor our Site.

Business Transactions:  . In the event that AHIP goes through a business transaction, such as a merger, acquisition by another company, or sale of all or a portion of its assets, please note that the personal identifying information collected and retained by AHIP will be among the assets transferred.

Training and Examination Information for Users Which Enroll in Certain AHIP Training Programs: . Individuals may enroll in AHIP training programs through this Site. . If agreed to by the individual enrolled in a program, AHIP may share certain training and examination information about that individual with third parties upon request.

What About the Use of Cookies?

AHIP may use cookies on its member website to personalize and customize the experience of its visitors and to support multiple levels of access to AHIP online. Cookies are pieces of information, which AHIP uses for record-keeping purposes, which the Site transfers to your computer’s Web-browser for storage on your computer’s hard drive. Cookies allows us to better understand and monitor how many people are using our site and for what purpose. We may also use cookies to retrieve certain information to help us determine which features and services are most important to you. AHIP, however, will not use cookies to record passwords or credit card or other financial information. Moreover, you can delete any cookies residing on your hard drive by following the instructions for your Web browser.

Many consider the use of cookies to be an industry standard. Consequently, your Web browser is likely set to accept cookies. If you would prefer not to receive cookies, you can alter the configuration of your browser to refuse cookies. If you choose to have your browser refuse cookies, you should understand that it is possible that some areas of our Site will not function properly when you view them.

By registering for a password and logging on to the member-level areas of the AHIP site, registered members need only enter their user name and password to AHIP Online once, utilizing enabled cookies. For subsequent visits, the website grants the user the option to “remember” username and password. If a user’s browser is configured to reject the cookie, they may still use our site. However, the user will be limited to the Guest portions of AHIP Online.

What About Digital Advertising?

AHIP allows third parties to place cookies through the Site in order to collect information about your visit to the Site and other websites to offer you more relevant advertising across the Internet. This practice is known as online behavioral advertising. . To learn more about these practices, and to opt-out of this data collection activity from companies participating in the Digital Advertising Alliance (“DAA”), go to the Digital Advertising Alliance Consumer Choice Page at www.aboutads.info/choices. . Please note that if you delete, block, or otherwise restrict cookies, or if you use a different computer or Internet browser, you may need to renew your opt-out choice.

What About External or Third Party Web Sites?

To the extent hyperlinks or gateways (whether through banner advertisements or otherwise) are utilized to access external or third party sites, you should be aware that these external or third party site are not controlled by AHIP and therefore, are not subject to this Privacy Policy. . AHIP suggests that you check the privacy policies of these sites to determine how the proprietors of these third party sites will utilize your personal identifying information.

What About Security?

AHIP places a premium on making sure that personal identifying information remains private and secure and is not subject to misuse or manipulation. . Accordingly, this Site has industry standard security measures in place, including storage of personal identifying information in a secure environment, to protect against the loss, misuse, and alteration of the information under AHIP’s control. . Although AHIP has endeavored to create a secure and reliable Site, the confidentiality of any communication or material transmitted via the Internet cannot be guaranteed. . Accordingly, you should consider carefully if you want to submit sensitive information via the Internet. . Messages that you send to us via e-mail may not be secure. AHIP suggests that you do not send any confidential information to us by e-mail. If you choose to send confidential information to us by e-mail, you accept the risk that a third party may intercept your information. . AHIP urges you to take every precaution to protect your personal identifying information when on-line.

What About Credit Card Protections?

Currently, this site collects information (e.g., name, title, employer, mailing address, telephone number, fax number, e-mail address, payment information) voluntarily provided by individuals who register for AHIP conferences or purchase AHIP products online. Sensitive information, such as your credit card number, are encrypted and protected with the encryption software SSL when transmitted to AHIP. Credit card information is not stored or re-used in any manner. Only authorized personnel with specific IDs and passwords can access credit card information solely for the purpose of processing authorized transactions.

What About Correcting, Deleting, or Updating Information?

At any time, you may contact AHIP at ahip@ahip.org to correct, modify, or delete the information you provide to AHIP through this Site, namely, your name, address, e-mail address and phone number. . Moreover, when you cease to use AHIP’s services and no longer wish to be included in AHIP database, you may contact AHIP at ahip@ahip.org to request to have your information removed from our database. . In the event that AHIP receives such a request or change, AHIP may require you to confirm or verify any change to your record. . Please note, however, that the collection and uses of certain personal identifying information is necessary to provide certain products and services through the Site and the deletion of such necessary information (e.g., an e-mail address) may render a particular service or AHIP’s ability to provide it inoperable.

What About Children?

AHIP cares about the safety of children on its Site and encourages parents and guardians to monitor their children’s use of the Internet. . Although the Site is suitable for a general audience, this Site is intended for use only by users who are over 18 years of age. . Accordingly, AHIP does not knowingly solicit personal identifying information from children or send them requests for personal information.

What About Any Other Questions?

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, the information collection and dissemination practices of this Site, or AHIP’s use of your personal identifying information, you can contact AHIP at AHIP, 601 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW, South Building, Suite 500, Washington, DC 20004, or ahip@ahip.org.

Terms of Service (TOS)

AMERICA’S HEALTH INSURANCE PLANS

Effective as of October 2017

Welcome to the web site owned and operated by America’s Health Insurance Plans, Inc. (referenced herein as “AHIP”).

IMPORTANT – THIS IS A LEGAL AGREEMENT BETWEEN YOU (REFERENCED HEREIN WITH “YOU,” “USER,” OR WITH “YOUR”) AND AHIP. BEFORE INSTALLING, ACCESSING, OR USING ANY PART OF THIS WEB SITE, YOU SHOULD READ THE FOLLOWING TERMS AND CONDITIONS CONTAINED IN THIS TERMS OF SERVICE AGREEMENT (THE “TOS”) CAREFULLY AS THEY GOVERN YOUR ACCESS TO AND USE OF THIS WEB SITE, THE MOBILE VERSION OF THE WEB SITE, ANY ASSOCIATED SOCIAL MEDIA PAGES, AND ANY PROGRAMS, SERVICES, ONLINE INTERACTIVE COMMUNICATION FORUMS, PRODUCTS, MATERIALS, DOCUMENTATION, AND INFORMATION AVAILABLE THROUGH THE WEB SITE OR USED IN CONNECTION THEREWITH (REFERENCED COLLECTIVELY HEREIN AS THE “SITE”). AHIP IS WILLING TO LICENSE THE USE OF THE SITE TO YOU ONLY ON THE CONDITION THAT YOU ACCEPT ALL OF THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS CONTAINED IN THIS TOS. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE WITH THIS TOS, YOU ARE NOT GRANTED PERMISSION BY AHIP TO ACCESS OR OTHERWISE USE THIS SITE AND ARE INSTRUCTED TO EXIT THIS SITE IMMEDIATELY.

1. LICENSE GRANT. This Site is provided by AHIP as a resource and to help promote access to affordable health care coverage to all Americans through a competitive marketplace that fosters choice, quality and innovation. This TOS provides you with a personal, revocable, limited, non-exclusive, royalty-free, nontransferable, nonsublicensable license to use this Site conditioned on your continued compliance with the terms and conditions of this TOS. You may print and download a single copy of the materials and information from this Site to a single computer solely for your personal or internal non-commercial use, provided that all hard copies contain all copyright and other applicable notices contained in such materials and information. This TOS is a license and not an assignment or sale. Any rights granted hereby are licensed and not sold or otherwise transferred to you. Accordingly, you expressly acknowledge and agree that AHIP transfers no ownership or intellectual property interest in and to the Site to you or anyone else. You also acknowledge and agree that: (i) AHIP has the right to control and direct the means, manner, and method by which the Site is provided. (ii) AHIP may, from time to time engage independent contractors, consultants, or subcontractors to aid AHIP in providing the Site or use thereof. and (iii) AHIP has the right to provide the Site to others.

2. LICENSE GRANT RESTRICTIONS. Notwithstanding the foregoing, you may not modify, alter, translate, decompile, reverse engineer, create derivative work(s) of, copy, distribute, disassemble, broadcast, transmit, reproduce, publish, display, remove or alter any proprietary notices or labels, license, sublicense, transfer, sell, mirror, frame, exploit, rent, lease, grant a security interest in, transfer any right(s) in, or otherwise use in any manner not expressly permitted herein the Site. Moreover, you may not (i) use any “deep link,” “page scrape,” “robot,” “spider,” or other automatic device, program, algorithm, or methodology, or any similar or equivalent manual process, to access, acquire, copy, or monitor any portion of the Site or in any way reproduce or circumvent the navigational structure or presentation of the Site to obtain or attempt to obtain any materials, documents, or information through any means not purposely made available through the Site, (ii) attempt to gain unauthorized access to any portion or feature of the Site or any other systems or networks connected to the Site or to any AHIP server or to any of the services offered on or through the Site, by hacking, password “mining,” or any other illegitimate means, (iii) probe, scan, or test the vulnerability of the Site or any network connected to the Site, nor breach the security or authentication measures on the Site or any network connected to the Site, (iv) reverse look-up, trace, or seek to trace any information on any other user of or visitor to the Site, (v) take any action that imposes an unreasonable or disproportionately large load on the infrastructure of the Site or AHIP’s systems or networks or any systems or networks connected to the Site, (vi) use any device, software, or routine to interfere with the proper working of the Site or any transaction conducted on the Site, or with any other person’s use of the Site, (vii) forge headers or otherwise manipulate identifiers in order to disguise the origin of any message or transmittal you send to AHIP on or through the Site, (viii) use the Site to transmit viruses, worms, Trojan horses, or other items or programs of a contaminating or destructive nature, and (ix) use the Site for any unauthorized purpose, including any unauthorized commercial purpose. WITHOUT LIMITING THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING, COPYING OR REPRODUCING ANY SERVICES, PROGRAMS, PRODUCTS, OR MATERIALS PROVIDED BY AHIP TO ANY OTHER SERVER OR LOCATION FOR FURTHER REPRODUCTION OR REDISTRIBUTION IS EXPRESSLY PROHIBITED. AHIP reserves the right to bar, restrict, suspend, or terminate any restricted activity and any User’s access to the Site.

3. User Name Handling Policy. Certain sections of the Site may require you to register as a user or create an account. . By registering or creating an account, you agree to provide accurate and complete information and to inform AHIP of any changes to that information. . Each registration is for a single user only, unless otherwise expressly provided on the registration page. Registration for access to and use of the Site may also require access credentials, such as a user name and a password, or adherence to other particular access requirements as designated by AHIP in its sole discretion from time to time. . You hereby agree to consider your access credentials, such as a user name and password, as confidential information and not to disclose such information to any third party without the prior express written consent of AHIP which may be withheld in its sole discretion. . You shall immediately notify AHIP if you suspect or become aware of any loss or theft of your password or any unauthorized use of your user name and password. . AHIP will not be liable for any loss or damage arising from your failure (whether inadvertent or intentional) to comply with these obligations.

4. USER OBLIGATIONS. By installing, accessing, or using this Site, you represent that you are at least eighteen (18) years of age (or the legal age of majority) and will, at all times, comply with the terms and conditions of this TOS and provide true, accurate, current, authorized, and complete information when submitting information or materials on this Site, including, without limitation, when you provide information via a Site registration form. If you breach the foregoing representations and warranties AHIP reserves the right to terminate your access and use of this Site and/or seek any and all remedies available at law and equity. In addition, you agree to abide by all applicable local, state, national, and international laws and regulations with respect to your use of this Site and agree not to interfere with the use and enjoyment of this Site by other Users and AHIP’s operation or management of this Site. Moreover, you agree not to: impersonate any other person or entity, whether actual or fictitious, including impersonating an employee or representative of AHIP, when using this Site, or defame or otherwise harm any party, including AHIP, through the use of this Site or any function of this Site. Use of the Internet and this Site is solely at your own risk and is subject to all applicable local, state, national, and international laws and regulations. While AHIP has endeavored to create a secure and reliable Site, you should understand that the confidentiality of any communication or material transmitted to/from the Site over the Internet or other global communication network cannot be guaranteed. Moreover, you understand that the technical processing and transmission of the Site may involve transmission over various networks. Accordingly, AHIP is not responsible for the security of any information transmitted via the Internet, the availability of such information, the accuracy of the information contained on the Site, or for the consequences of any reliance on such information. You assume sole and complete risk for using this Site and must make your own determination as to these issues.

5. PROPRIETARY RIGHTS. All text, graphics, user interfaces, visual interfaces, photographs, sounds, artwork, computer code (including html code), programs, software, products, information, and documentation as well as the design, structure, selection, coordination, expression, “look and feel,” and arrangement of any content contained on or available through the Site, unless otherwise indicated, are owned, controlled, and licensed by AHIP and are protected by law including, but not limited to, United States copyright, trade secret, patent, and trademark law, as well as other state, national, and international laws and regulations. Except as expressly provided herein, AHIP does not grant any express or implied right to you or any other person under any intellectual or proprietary rights. Accordingly, your unauthorized use of this Site may violate intellectual property or other proprietary rights laws as well as other laws, regulations, and statutes. Please be aware that AHIP actively and aggressively enforces its intellectual property rights to the fullest extent of the law. This Site and its contents are Copyright © 2004-2017 America’s Health Insurance Plans and/or its licensors. All rights reserved. AHIP also owns a copyright in the contents of the Site as collective work and/or compilation and in the selection, coordination, arrangement, and enhancement of the content of this Site. Any software and other downloadable or printable programs, information, or materials available through this Site and all copyrights, trade secrets, and know-how related thereto, unless otherwise indicated, are owned by AHIP and/or its licensors. AMERICA’S HEALTH INSURANCE PLANS, AHIP, the AHIP logo, and all other names, logos, and icons identifying AHIP and its products and services are proprietary trademarks of AHIP, and any use of such marks without the express written permission of AHIP is strictly prohibited. Other product and company names mentioned herein may be the trademarks and/or service marks of their respective owners. AHIP encourages and permits text links to this Site and its content. But, AHIP permits you to post a link to this Site only with express written consent of AHIP and only to the primary landing page (or other designated page) for the Site using AHIP’s plain character trade name. Further, any links to this Site should not suggest that AHIP promotes or otherwise endorses any third party products, services, causes, campaigns, websites, content, or information. Moreover, no link may be used for commercial or fundraising purposes. Any link to this Site may not use or include any other AHIP logos, content, or designs without the express written consent of AHIP.

6. OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS. Additional terms and conditions (available when you access particular features or areas of this Site) may apply to the downloading of software, the purchase of products or services through the AHIP store, and to other specific portions or features of the Site. You agree to abide by such other terms and conditions, including where applicable representing that you are of sufficient legal age to purchase, use or participate in such service or feature. If there is a conflict between this TOS and the terms posted for or applicable to a specific portion of the Site, including for any products or service offered on or through the Site, AHIP shall resolve any conflict in good faith in its sole discretion the latter terms shall control with respect to your use of that portion of the Site or the specific product or service. AHIP’s obligations, if any, with respect to its products and/or services are governed solely by the agreements pursuant to which they are provided, and nothing on this Site should be construed to alter such agreements.

7. PRIVACY POLICY. Use of the Site may require the submission of certain personally identifiable information. Please review AHIP’s Privacy Policy found at [LINK] for a summary of AHIP’s practices related to the collection of personal identifiable information from the Site.

8. ENFORCING SECURITY ON THE SITE. Any actual or attempted use of the Site by you in violation of this Agreement may result in criminal/or civil prosecution, including, without limitation, punishment under the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act of 1986 under U.S. federal law. Accordingly, AHIP reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to view, monitor, and record activity relating to your use of the Site without notice or permission from you, including, without limitation, by archiving content and/or communications submitted to and/or sent by you through the Site. AHIP may share any information obtained by monitoring, reviewing, or recording with law enforcement organizations in connection with investigation or prosecution of possible criminal or unlawful activity on the Site. AHIP will also comply with all court orders and/or subpoenas involving requests for such information. In addition to the foregoing, AHIP reserves the right to at any time, and without notice, to modify, suspend, terminate, or interrupt operation of or access to the Site, or any portion of the Site, for any reason.

9. FEEDBACK. AHIP welcomes your feedback and suggestions about how to improve this Site. By transmitting any suggestions, information, material, or other content (collectively, “feedback”) to AHIP, you represent and warrant that such feedback does not infringe the intellectual property or proprietary rights of any third party (including, without limitation, patents, copyrights, or trademark rights) and that you have all rights necessary to convey such feedback to AHIP. In addition, any feedback received through this Site will be deemed to include a royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, transferable, non-exclusive right and license for AHIP to adopt, publish, reproduce, disseminate, transmit, distribute, copy, use, create derivative works, and display (in whole or in part) worldwide, or act on such feedback without additional approval or consideration, in any form, media, or technology now known or later developed for the full term of any rights that may exist in such content, and you hereby waive any claim to the contrary.

10. THIRD PARTY PRODUCTS, SERVICES &. ADVERTISEMENTS. You acknowledge and agree that this Site may feature materials, products, and services provided by other Users of the Site and third parties. AHIP makes no representations with respect to, nor does it guarantee or endorse, the quality, non-infringement, accuracy, completeness, timeliness, reliability, or correct sequencing of such third party materials, products, and services or any other materials, products, and services which such third party materials, products, and services may access. AHIP expressly disclaims responsibility and liability for all third party provided materials, products, and services contained on or accessed through the Site. Likewise, AHIP, in its sole discretion, may post (and remove at any time) the advertisements or logos of conference sponsors, business partners, and other third parties on this Site. The inclusion of advertisements or logos on the Site does not imply endorsement of the advertised products or services, or of a company by AHIP. Your correspondence or any other dealings with advertisers or companies found on this site are solely between you and such advertiser or company. You agree that AHIP shall not be responsible for any loss or damage of any sort incurred as a result of any such dealings or as the result of the presence of such advertisers or companies on this Site. Moreover, AHIP shall not be responsible or liable for the statements or conduct of any third party on this Site.

11. SOCIAL MEDIA/INTERACTIVE COMMUNICATION FORUMS. You acknowledge and agree that this Site may feature interactive communication forums, blogs and/or other social media networks (“AHIP Forums”) where Users may have the ability to post content, communicate, or submit to us materials such as comments, remarks, responses, suggestions, ideas, graphics, opinions, photos, videos, entries to promotions or other information or content created by Users (“Submissions”). Any Submission you provide to AHIP should reflect your own honest opinions, findings, beliefs or experience and you warrant that you have the rights to provide such Submissions. Access to and use of . AHIP Forums are limited to communications, promotion and other activities relating to promoting access to affordable health care coverage to all Americans through a competitive marketplace that fosters choice, quality and innovation.

If you choose to share any ideas on an AHIP Forum, please note that AHIP cannot guarantee that other Users or third parties will not use or otherwise disseminate the ideas that you share and AHIP shall have no liability for third party use of a your Submissions. Therefore, if you have an idea that you would like to keep confidential and/or do not want others, including AHIP to use, do not post it to an AHIP Forum. Further you agree that by using an AHIP Forum you will not upload, post, display, or transmit any of the following materials as a Submission to an AHIP Forum:

  • anything that interferes with or disrupts an AHIP Forum, the Site or the operation thereof,
  • statements or material that defames, harasses, abuses, stalks, threatens, intimidates, or in any way violates the rights of others,
  • unauthorized copyrighted materials or any other material that infringes on the intellectual property rights, trade secrets, or privacy of others,
  • statements or material that violates other contractual or fiduciary rights, duties, or agreements,
  • statements or material that is bigoted, hateful, or racially offensive,
  • statements or material that encourages criminal conduct or that would give rise to civil liability or otherwise violates any law or regulation in any jurisdiction,
  • statements or material that constitutes anti-competitive collaboration and/or antitrust violations,
  • statements or material that contains vulgar, obscene, profane, or otherwise objectionable language or images that typically would not be considered socially or professionally responsible or appropriate in person,
  • statements or material that harms minors,
  • statements or material that impersonates any other person or entity, whether actual or fictitious, including, without limitation, employees and representatives of AHIP,
  • statements or material that misrepresents your affiliation with any entity and/or AHIP,
  • anything that violates the privacy or publicity rights of any other person, including, without limitation, posting any personal identifying information of another individual,
  • chain letters or pyramid schemes,
  • statements or materials that are deceptive or misleading,
  • statements or material that constitutes junk mail, spam, or unauthorized advertising or promotional materials,
  • statements or material that are “off-topic” for a designated Submission, and
  • files that contain malicious code, viruses, corrupted files, or any other similar software or programs that may damage the operation of another’s computer, network, or the Site.

You are solely responsible for (a) any Submission you post on or through an AHIP Forum, (b) any material or information that you provide to other Users (or others that view an AHIP Forum), and (c) your interaction with other Users (or others that view an AHIP Forum).

12. PERMISSION TO USE SUBMISSIONS. By posting a Submission on an AHIP Forum, you agree that you provide AHIP with a nonexclusive, worldwide, fully paid-up and royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, transferrable, assignable and unlimited license to use, reproduce, transmit, perform, display, sublicense, and create derivative works of all or any portion of your Submission in any way that we see fit and for any purpose whatsoever. AHIP hereby reserves the right to use the posted Submission and AHIP and its designees may exploit, edit, modify, and distribute the content and any and all elements of such Submission, in any and all media now known or not currently known, throughout the world in perpetuity without compensation, permission or notification to you or any third party. You represent that you have all necessary rights to make the Submissions available to AHIP and you also acknowledge that AHIP has no control over the extent to which any idea or information may be used by any party or person once you post or display it to a public area of the Site (or permit such posting or display). . Accordingly, notwithstanding this right and license, it is understood that by merely permitting your information, content, and materials to be collected through or appear on an AHIP Forum, AHIP has not become and is not necessarily a publisher of such information, content, and materials and is merely functioning as an intermediary to enable you to provide and display a Submission. . Moreover, AHIP assumes no responsibility for the deletion of or failure to store any Submission and recommends that you do not post, display, or transmit any confidential or sensitive information.

13. NO PRE-SCREENING OF SUBMISSIONS. AHIP is not responsible for screening or editing your or another User’s Submissions and encourages all of its Users to use reasonable discretion and caution in evaluating or reviewing any Submission. Moreover, and except as provided below with respect to AHIP’s right and ability to delete or remove a Submission (or any part thereof), AHIP does not endorse, oppose, or edit any opinion or information provided by you or another User and does not make any representation with respect to, nor does it endorse the accuracy, acceptability, completeness, timeliness, or reliability of any advice, opinion, statement, or other material displayed, uploaded, or distributed by you or any other User. . Nevertheless, AHIP reserves the right to delete or take other action with respect to Submissions (or parts thereof) that AHIP believes in good faith violate this TOS and/or are, or are potentially, unlawful or harmful to AHIP or its affiliates, volunteers, services, or goodwill. . If you violate this TOS, AHIP may, in its sole discretion, delete the unacceptable content from your Submission, remove or delete the Submission in its entirety, issue you a warning, and/or terminate your use of the Site and/or AHIP Forum. . Moreover, it is a policy of AHIP to take appropriate actions under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act under U.S. Copyright Law and other applicable intellectual property laws. . If you become aware of Submissions that violate these rules regarding acceptable behavior or content, you may contact AHIP as provided below.

14. COPYRIGHT. DESIGNATED AGENT FOR NOTIFICATION OF CLAIMS OF INFRINGEMENT. AHIP respects the intellectual property of others, and it asks its Users to do the same. Accordingly, it is AHIP’s policy to respond to a notice of alleged infringement that complies with U.S. Copyright Law, and in particular, the Digital Millennium Copyright Act. . Responses may include removing or disabling access to content or material claimed to be the subject of infringing activity and/or terminating your right to access and use the Site and AHIP Forums. . But, you acknowledge that you may be liable for damages, including attorneys’ fees and costs, if you materially misrepresent that a work or activity is infringing your rights. . If AHIP terminates or suspends a User’s access to or use of the Site and/or AHIP Forums, AHIP will make a good-faith attempt (as warranted) to contact the person who posted the content so that they may make counter notification pursuant to applicable laws. . It is AHIP’s policy to document all notices of alleged infringement upon which AHIP decides to take action. . As with all legal notices, a copy of the notice may be sent to one or more third parties who may make such notice available to the public. . If you believe that one or more of your works have been copied in a way that constitutes copyright infringement, please provide a written notice of your claim of copyright infringement that is directed to AHIP’s designated agent as specified below along with the following information:

  • A signature of a person authorized to act on behalf of the owner of the copyright interest that is allegedly infringed;
  • A description, in reasonable detail (including any applicable URL address), of the copyrighted work that you claim has been infringed;
  • A description, in reasonable detail, of where the material that you claim is infringing is located on the Site;
  • Your address, telephone number, and e-mail address;
